channel.title: How to get into your router/firewall?
channel.description: Hey guys, i need help. On the post "how to make a server" in the tut's forum i did everything but unfortunataly it still didn't work. So im trying to do the optional step that says to go into your firewall and router and open up port 43594. But, i do not know how to do that. If someone could tell me how to get into my firewall and router and open up the port, that would be very helpfull. Also: please do it in step by step instructions, i do not do very well with just a big paragraph. Thanks and whoever does this for me will get rep!!!

item.title: How to get into your router/firewall?
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“fluster, post:3, topic:223674”]ok i did what you said and it still does not work, do i have to disable firewall protection, disable block Anonymous internet requests, or do i need to disable both. Because if i disable firewall that would leave my router exposed to virusus, spyware etc…

btw: i have my windows firewall off because i have a whole program that i buy every month for firewall protection, spyware protection, virus protection, etc…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 03, 2008, 07:04:31 pm[/size][hr]OMG I DID IT!!! OMG THANKS!!![br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 03, 2008, 07:05:00 pm[/size][hr]IT WAS MY WINDOWS FIREWALL THAT WAS BLOCKING LOL!!! UR GET TONS OF REP![br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 03, 2008, 07:07:40 pm[/size][hr]how do i give rep anyways lol[/quote]LMFAO you cant rep you idiot your only 10 rep, you need 15 to rep.
neither of you can rep.

item.source: How to get into your router/firewall?

item.title: How to get into your router/firewall?
item.dc:creator: @Blackened46 Blackened46
item.description:
@Blackened46 wrote:

1.If you have a router then open up an internet browser and type either Http://192.168.0.1 or for some people its Http://192.168.0.0 (the first one usually works)

  1. log into your router, after that has been done find port forwarding.

3.Once you have reached this step, type in the private ip address of the computer your useing

  1. if you do not know how to do this click start, ‘run’ and type cmd and click ok.

  2. in the command prompt type ‘ipconfig’ and you should see an ip address that looks similar to ‘192.186.0.130’ the last three numbers will be different than ‘130’.

6.after you have done that enter TDC and UDP ports as 43594, if you only have one place to inter a port then put it in as 43594 and make sure the firewall for it is set to allow.

  1. save this and and it should work if your windows firewall settings are on your can try the next step.

  2. if your running a windows operating system you can also try adding a port into your firewall settings, you shouldnt have to but just incase try this.

  3. click start and open up your network connections.

10.under network task on the top right side of your network connections click ‘change windows firewall settings’.

  1. in the general tab of windows firewall make sure dont allow execption is NOT checked if the firewall is on.

  2. next click the exeptions tap at the top.

13.click ‘add port’ at the bottom of the screen and give it anyname you wish and put the port number as ‘43594’ and click ‘TCP’

  1. click ok and your done this should work

Read full topic
